SiteNameAddress: Brampton Manor, Old Road, Chesterfield
Notes: Parts of the site have potential for future residential develoment subject to consideration of the impact upon listed structures/buildings and scheduled ancient monuments.

SiteNameAddress: Brockwell Court (Former), Cheedale Avenue, Newbold, Chesterfield
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: The site has been occupied by a permanent structure but the remains have not sufficiently blended into the landscape over the process of time. There is a possibility that the site may be required to meet unmet open space needs but there is no conclusive evidence to this effect, Whilst the nearby junior school is at capacity certain types of residential development would be possible without an increase in demand for school places. Furthermore the potential for expansion of the nearby schools is as yet undetermined. Provided biodiversity impacts can be mitigated the site would be appropriate for residential development.

SiteNameAddress: Catherine Street, Bank Street and Catherine Street Chesterfield
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: The site appropriate for residential development.  Constraints identified within the LAA are likely to be mitigable.

SiteNameAddress: Land at Duewell Court, Station Road, Barrow Hill
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: Whilst no local centre is nearby (notwithstanding any centre developed within the Staveley Rother Corridor), the site is still appropriate for residential development being in regeneration priority area.  Identified constraints are likely to be mitigable.

SiteNameAddress: Heaton Court (Former), Meynell Close, Chesterfield
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: The site is appropriate for residential development in terms of access to centres, services and facilities. Identified constraints are likely to be mitigable.

SiteNameAddress: Miller Avenue, Mastin Moor, Chesterfield
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: The site is appropriate for residential development despite no local centre nearby and limited accessibility to services and facilities given that it is within a regeneration priority area. Identified constraints are likely to be mitigable.

SiteNameAddress: Ashbrook Centre (Former), Cuttholme Road, Chesterfield
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: The site has been occupied by a permanent structure but the remains have not sufficiently blended into the landscape over the process of time.  It is in a location accessible to a centre and with reasonable accessibility to services and facilities and it is likely that constraints can be mitigated.

SiteNameAddress: Allen & Orr Timber Yard
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: Included within draft local plan. The site has no significant physical or environmental constraints and those identified, including access, highway network limitations, heritage impact, air pollution, land stability should be mitigable.

SiteNameAddress: Inkersall Social Club, Inkersall Green, Inkersall

SiteNameAddress: North East Derbyshire District Council Offices (Former), Saltergate, Chesterfield
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: The site is appropriate for residential development, the loss of the offices on the site is policy compliant, there being no overriding planning reasons to protect the premises and land from other town centre uses. Identified constraints are likely to be mitigable. application awaiting decision (care units). Full application awaiting decision.

SiteNameAddress: Elm Street, Hollingwood, Brimington,
Notes: The site has been occupied by a permanent structure but the remains have not sufficiently blended into the landscape over the process of time. Whilst nearby schools are at capacity certain types of residential development would be possible without an increase in demand for school places. Furthermore the potential for expansion of the nearby schools is as yet undetermined. The site has constraints but non appear to be unmitigable and the site is appropriate for residential development.

SiteNameAddress: Derwent House HOP, Ulverston Road, Chesterfield
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: The site is an appropriate location for residential development. Identified constraints are likely to be mitigable.

SiteNameAddress: Red House HOP & Spire Lodge, Sheffield Road, Chesterfield
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: On the basis that the site would only be available should Derbyshire County Council have concluded that the service/facility provided is no longer necessary the site is an appropriate location for residential development. The constraints posed by Sheffield Road to the west is not significant. Other identified constraints are likely to be mitigable.

SiteNameAddress: Ash Glen Nursery (Former), Sheffield Road, Unstone
Notes: The site is not essential to ensuring an adequate supply of employment land or premises in terms of quantity. There is a need for further information on the relationship with adjoining commercial/industrial land uses and whether or not a good level of amenity might be feasible should adjoining land uses continue in commercial/industrial use. The site is not within walking distance of a centre and is not within a Regeneration Priority Area. There is insuffiicent information on the adequacy of education and GP provision in the locality. Accordingly the site is not currently considered to be appropriate for residential development.
